title: Friday Morning Birdwatching by Canoe
text: Description The slow-flowing Ipswich River is a magical place to view wetland breeding birds. We'll meander up and down the river making frequent stops to look and listen for Virgina Rail, Sora, Yellow-throated Vireo, Great-crested Flycatcher, and many other species that raise their young in nests and tree cavities along the river. The canoes will allow us to venture deep into the freshwater marsh for a peaceful experience that combines birdwatching and boating. Checking registration status. When - Fri, Jul 19, 2024 8:00 am - 10:30 am Who Adults Cost - Adult Members $30 - Adult Nonmembers $35 Where Location: Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary, Topsfield - Questions? Contact us: - [978-887-9264](tel:978-887-9264) [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#1970696a6e707a716b706f7c6b5974786a6a786c7d6c7b767737766b7e) Instructors - Scott Santino - Statewide Trips, Travel and Certificate Programs Manager Instructions Meets in front of the Visitor Center. All equipment will be provided. Participants should have some canoeing experience and be able to walk a half mile on uneven terrain. Wear footwear appropriate for muddy trails. Bring a water bottle, binoculars and a drybag for personal items, if you have one.
